title: Baby Bottle

adjectives: Feeling hunger; feeling a need or desire to eat food
Affected by hunger; desirous of food.
Desirous of food; having a physical need for food.
Affected by hunger; desiring of food; having a physical need for food.
verbs: To drink or imbibe with vigour or relish; to drink copiously; to swallow in large draughts.
To consume a liquid through the mouth.
To consume (a liquid) through the mouth.
nouns: A white nutritious liquid secreted by mammals and used as food by human beings
Milk from a cow.
Milk is a white liquid produced by the mammary glands of mammals.
Milk that contains at least 3.5% fat.
The whitish fluid secreted by the mammary gland for the nourishment of the young; composed of carbohydrates, proteins, fats, mineral salts, vitamins, and antibodies.
Nutrient-rich liquids secreted by the mammary glands of female mammals
White liquid produced by the mammary glands of mammals

A white liquid produced by the mammary glands of female mammals to nourish their young. From certain animals, especially cows, it is a common food for humans as a beverage or used to produce various dairy products such as butter, cheese, and yogurt.
A dairy cow
Any drinkable liquid; a beverage.
Any liquid suitable for drinking
Kind of liquid which is specifically prepared for human consumption
A beverage.
Any one of various liquids for drinking.
Drinks, or beverages, are liquids specifically prepared for human consumption.
A bottle equipped with a teat, used for feeding infants.
Bottle with a teat.
A baby bottle is a bottle with a teat to drink directly from.
Bottle with a nipple to drink directly from
A glass or plastic vessel used for storing drinks or other liquids; typically cylindrical without handles and with a narrow neck that can be plugged or capped
A bottle is a rigid container with a neck that is narrower than the body and a "mouth".
Container of liquids
A container, typically made of glass and having a tapered neck, used for holding liquids.
A container, typically made of glass or plastic and having a tapered neck, used primarily for holding liquids.
A bottle for feeding milk to babies or to the young of other animals.
A container with a rubber nipple used for giving liquids to infants, a baby bottle.
A vessel fitted with a flexible teat and filled with milk or formula; used as a substitute for breast feeding infants and very young children
A container with a rubber nipple used for giving liquids to infants.

description: A bottle of milk or formula, as or fed to a baby, with a bluish cap and rubber nipple or teat. Positioned upright or at a 45° angle, and filled to various levels, sometimes showing fill lines. Often used for newborns and childrearing. See also Breast-Feeding.
apple_vendor_description: The baby bottle emoji on Apple devices presents a perfectly formed, clear container with a gentle sheen, showcasing a hint of milky liquid within. Its soft, rounded edges and realistic lighting emphasize its wholesome and nurturing purpose. This familiar icon, often depicted with a subtle tilt, is a universal symbol of infancy, care, and new beginnings in conversations.
